div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 478px; height: 1px; padding-top: 3008px; margin-left: 3922px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
FCWorker::
run
()
While true:
`Select` all channels.
case
fc_able_commit_vers
:
flush_and_compact( probe_commit_ver );
case
min_held_list_ver
:
dangling_nodes
.gc_old_nodes( mhlv );
case
is_terminating
:
break;
poll_held_list_vers_then_gc();

div.div:
enum
CommittedEntrySet<K, V>
:
RMemLog( ReadOnlyMemlog<K, V> )
SSTable( SSTable<K, V> )
+ get_one( &Q ) -> Opt< Entry<K, V> >
+ get_range( Opt<&Q>, Opt<&Q> ) -> Iter< Entry<K, V> >
+ get_all_keys() -> Iter< Entry<K, ()> >

div.div:
enum
Entry
<'a, K, V> {
Ref(( &'a K, &'a V )),
Own(Res<( K, V )>),
}
+ try_borrow() -> Res<( &'a K, &'a V )>
+ into_owned_kv() -> Res<( K, V )>
etc

div.div:
fn
merge_committed_entrysets
(
Iter< &CommittedEntrySet<K, V> >,
k_lo: Opt<&Q>,
k_hi: Opt<&Q>,
) -> Iter< Entry<K,V> >
fn
merge_txnlocal_and_committed_entrysets
(
Opt< &WritableMemLog<K, V> >,
Iter< &CommittedEntrySet<K, V> >,
k_lo: Opt<&Q>,
k_hi: Opt<&Q>,
) -> Iter< Entry<K,V> >

ul.li:
commit_info.txt (<-> struct CommitInfo)
(This file is present iff this unit was attempted commitment.
There is currently no way to distinguish a failed and a finalized commit.)

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 162px; height: 80px; padding-top: 2961px; margin-left: 320px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; width: 160px; height: 80px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; width: 100%; height: 100%; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 242px; height: 160px; padding-top: 1801px; margin-left: 1400px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; width: 240px; height: 160px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; width: 100%; height: 100%; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 718px; height: 1px; padding-top: 3168px; margin-left: 2482px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

li.span: When actually committing, handle this anomaly:
Problem: Actually committed CommittedUnit vs never pushed CommittedUnit are indistinguishable.
Ensure that any crash during commitment propagates, s.t. further commitments are impossible.

ul.li: Flush some info to disk, a second time, _after_ the node is pushed to the LL.
where the second info could be e.g.
replacement_num is flushed as None; then push to LL; then replacement_num is finalized
CRC is initially missing; then push to LL; then CRC is flushed

li.span: F+C goes through recent commits, and sets replacement_num=Some(zero)
(This is too complicated and likely causes some incorrectness.)

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 3068px; margin-left: 3710px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(153, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 678px; height: 1px; padding-top: 3568px; margin-left: 3842px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
FCWorker::
flush_and_compact
( probe_commit_ver: CommitVer )
With db_state_guard =
db_state
.
lock_shared
() :
/* This guard is held for the duration of flushing-and-compacting one segment. */
With
lsm_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
Walk
boundaries
(OrderedDict) to determine the segment.
Loop :
Flush+compact one segment.
With
lsm_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
Modify the LL, replacing the segment with the flushed+compacted node.
Bump
curr_list_ver
.
Save the now-dangling nodes in
dangling_nodes
.
Try to advance
min_held_list_ver
.
If
min_held_list_ver
advanced : GC some nodes in
dangling_nodes
.
Walk
boundaries
(OrderedDict) to determine the segment.
/* See another diagram for details. */

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 3228px; margin-left: 3710px;

display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(153, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: nowrap;

display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 598px; height: 1px; padding-top: 3288px; margin-left: 6362px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
DB::
delete_scnd_idx
( sv_spec )
With
db_state
.
lock_shared
() :
scnd_idxs
[ sv_spec ] is Some, and its
is_readable
== false
Return error.
With
db_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
scnd_idxs
[ sv_spec ] is Some, and its
is_readable
== false
Return error.
scnd_idxs
.remove( sv_spec );
Serialize ScndIdxsState to disk.

div.div: Are there any data to commit?

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 758px; height: 1px; padding-top: 2888px; margin-left: 1442px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Txn::
new
( db, db_state_guard )
With
lsm_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
Hold
curr_commit_ver
->
commit_ver_hi_incl
Get
list
snapshot ->
list_iter
Hold
curr_list_ver
->
snap_list_ver
dependent_itvs_prim
:= new empty;
dependent_itvs_scnds
:= new empty;
staging
:= None;

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 758px; height: 1px; padding-top: 3248px; margin-left: 1442px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Txn::
try_commit
()
staging
.flush();
With
lsm_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
/* Some lines here should be done outside the mutex guard. They're lumped in here for legibility. */
If
snap_commit_ver
!=
curr_commit_ver
:
Unhold
commit_ver_lo_excl
.
Detect a new isolated non-held boundary. If detected,
fc_able_commit_vers
.send(...);
commit_ver_hi_incl
->
commit_ver_lo_incl
Hold
curr_commit_ver
->
commit_ver_hi_incl
Get
list
snapshot between new
commit_ver_hi_incl
and previous
commit_ver_lo_incl
->
list_iter
Unhold
snap_list_ver
.
Try to advance
min_held_list_ver
.
If
min_held_list_ver
advanced :
min_held_list_ver
.send_if_modified( if last-sent mhlv < known mhlv );
Hold
curr_list_ver
->
snap_list_ver
return "need to check for conflict";
Else :
curr_commit_ver
+= 1;
committed_unit := CommittedUnit::from(
staging
,
curr_commit_ver
);
/* Serializing is not cheap, and we're doing it under mutex guard! */
On disk, serialize CommitInfo with ...
commit_ver_lo_incl == commit_ver_hi_incl :=
curr_commit_ver
replacement_num := 0
In memory, move each WritableMemLog into ReadonlyMemLog.
node := Box( ListNode( ... committed_unit ... ) )
list
.push_head
( node );
Unhold
commit_ver_hi_incl
and
commit_ver_lo_excl
.
Detect new isolated non-held boundaries. If detected,
fc_able_commit_vers
.send(...);
Unhold
snap_list_ver
.
Try to advance
min_held_list_ver
.
If
min_held_list_ver
advanced :
min_held_list_ver
.send_if_modified( if last-sent mhlv < known mhlv );
return "just committed";

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 758px; height: 1px; padding-top: 4048px; margin-left: 1442px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Txn::
has_conflict()
For each CommittedUnit in
snap
:
For each of {PI and SIs} that was written-to in
staging
:
If {
dependent_itvs_*
<--> CommittedEntrySet } overlap :
Return "yes conflict".
Return "no conflict".

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 18px; height: 1px; padding-top: 4051px; margin-left: 931px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 758px; height: 1px; padding-top: 4288px; margin-left: 1442px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Txn::
reset
()
With
lsm_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
/* Some lines here should be done outside the mutex guard. They're lumped in here for legibility. */
Unhold
commit_ver_hi_incl
and
commit_ver_lo_excl
.
Detect new isolated non-held boundaries. If detected,
fc_able_commit_vers
.send(...);
None ->
commit_ver_lo_excl
Hold
curr_commit_ver
->
commit_ver_hi_incl
Get
list
snapshot ->
list_iter
Unhold
snap_list_ver
.
Try to advance
min_held_list_ver
.
If
min_held_list_ver
advanced :
min_held_list_ver
.send_if_modified( if last-sent mhlv < known mhlv );
Hold
curr_list_ver
->
snap_list_ver
dependent_itvs_prim
.clear();
dependent_itvs_scnds
.clear();
if
staging
is Some :
staging
.clear();

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 758px; height: 1px; padding-top: 4768px; margin-left: 1442px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Txn::
close
()
With
lsm_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
/* Some lines here should be done outside the mutex guard. They're lumped in here for legibility. */
Unhold
commit_ver_hi_incl
and
commit_ver_lo_excl
.
Detect new isolated non-held boundaries. If detected,
fc_able_commit_vers
.send(...);
Unhold
snap_list_ver
.
Try to advance
min_held_list_ver
.
If
min_held_list_ver
advanced :
min_held_list_ver
.send_if_modified( if last-sent mhlv < known mhlv );
if
staging
is Some :
staging
.remove_dir();

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 362px; height: 400px; padding-top: 2561px; margin-left: 680px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; width: 360px; height: 400px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; width: 100%; height: 100%; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 558px; height: 1px; padding-top: 3208px; margin-left: 2px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
/* All these methdos are public to the client callback. */
Txn::
get_pk_one
( pk )
dependent_itvs_prim
.add( (pk,pk) );
stg :=
staging
.map( (stg) -> stg.prim );
snap :=
snap
.map( (unit) -> unit.prim );
Get one from [stg, snap]. Return result.
Txn::
get_pk_range
( pk_lo, pk_hi )
dependent_itvs_prim
.add( (pk_lo,pk_hi) );
if
snap_cache
is None: collect it from
snap
.
stg :=
staging
.map( (stg) -> stg.prim );
snap :=
snap_cache
.map( (unit) -> unit.prim );
K-merge [stg, snap]. Return result.
Txn::
get_sv_range
( sv_spec, sv_lo, sv_hi )
/* This is a simplistic query engine, which depends on exactly one index. */
If
scnd_idxs
[sv_spec] doesn't exist or
is_readable
==false: return failure.
si_num :=
scnd_idxs
[sv_spec].si_num;
If
dependent_itvs_scnds
[si_num] doesn't exist: create new empty.
dependent_itvs_scnds
[si_num].add( (sv_lo,sv_hi) );
if
snap_cache
is None: collect it from
snap
.
stg :=
staging
.map( (stg) -> stg.scnds.get(si_num) );
snap :=
snap_cache
.map( (unit) -> unit.scnds.get(si_num) );
K-merge [stg, snap]. Return result.
Txn::
put
( pk, new_pv )
dependent_itvs_prim
.add( (pk,pk) );
/* We must treat concurrent writes on the same PK as a conflict, because they generally invalidate deltas on SIs in staging. */
stg :=
staging
.map( (stg) -> stg.prim );
snap :=
snap
.map( (unit) -> unit.prim );
old_pv := Get one from [stg, snap];
If
staging
is None: create new empty.
For each si_num in
scnd_idxs
:
/* Assess all SIs, regardless of `is_readable
`. */
If there is a delta for this SI:
If
staging
.scnds[si_num] doesn't exist: create new empty.
staging
.scnds[si_num].put( the_delta );
staging
.prim
.put( (PK,PV) );

switch.text: /* All these methdos are public to the client callback. */...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1741px; margin-left: 3580px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 442px; height: 320px; padding-top: 1801px; margin-left: 3360px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; width: 440px; height: 320px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; width: 100%; height: 100%; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 3600px; margin-left: 750px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 3981px; margin-left: 1041px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 598px; height: 1px; padding-top: 2548px; margin-left: 2482px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

li.span: /* We must do them in this order. */

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 518px; height: 1px; padding-top: 2528px; margin-left: 3162px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
FCWorker::
poll_held_list_vers_then_gc
()
/* F+C worker no longer attempts to do any F+C'ing, and instead only waits to complete GC'ing.
Hence, F+C is interested in list_ver info only, not commit_ver info. */
/*
min_held_list_ver
does not inform whether
curr_list_ver
is held or not. But this is irrelevant for the purpose of GC. */
While true :
With
lsm_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
If (
min_held_list_ver
==
curr_list_ver
) or (
held_list_vers
is empty) :
/* Either check is correct. */
break;
Sleep a bit.
For each (_, nodes) in
dangling_nodes
:
For each node in nodes :
Remove files. Drop memory.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 438px; height: 1px; padding-top: 3048px; margin-left: 642px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Txn::
run
( db, retry_limit, client_cb )
With db_state_guard =
db_state
.
lock_shared
() :
/* This guard is held for the duration of the txn. */
If
is_terminating
== true :
Return error.
txn := Txn::new( ... );
Make the txn go through the state transitions.
Return what client_cb returns.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 841px; margin-left: 2360px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 941px; margin-left: 2480px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: nowrap;

display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 278px; height: 1px; padding-top: 4088px; margin-left: 82px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

li.span: StagingUnit should be able to contain both in-memory and on-disk components, to support txns that write a lot of data, eg a bulk upload.
On-disk component could be SSTable, or could be a {heap file (the "commit log" file) + intra-file pointers} combo.

ul.li: Each *Unit type should do levelled compaction within.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 758px; height: 1px; padding-top: 3288px; margin-left: 5362px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
The creation flow
With
db_state
.
lock_shared
() :
If
is_terminating
== true :
Return error.
If
scnd_idxs
.has_key( sv_spec ) :
Return error.
With
db_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
If
is_terminating
== true :
Return error.
If
scnd_idxs
.has_key( sv_spec ) :
Return error.
si_num
:=
next_scnd_idx_num
.fetch_inc();
scnd_idxs
.insert( sv_spec, ( si_num,
is_readable
=false ) );
Serialize ScndIdxsState to disk.
With
lsm_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
Hold
curr_commit_ver
->
pre_output_commit_ver
output_node
= a new node containing a new empty CommittedUnit.
list
.push_head(
output_node
);
list
->
snap
curr_commit_ver
+= 1;
Hold
curr_commit_ver
->
output_commit_ver
Hold
curr_list_ver
->
snap_list_ver
/* Comment */
While
db_state
was exclusively locked, ...
No txn was in progress, and no new txns could start.
F+C was not traversing the LL.
After the lock on
db_state
is released, ...
New txns can start again. New commitments will write deltas to the new (not yet readable) SI.
F+C can traverse the LL again. F+C is guaranteed to not replace-away the
output_node
, by an implicit contract that a pair of adjacent boundaries shall be separated by 1+ nodes (actually exactly 1 node).
For each node in
snap
:
If the node contains a PI file :
Hard-link the PI file into a staging dir.
With
lsm_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
Unhold
snap_list_ver
.
Try to advance
min_held_list_ver
.
If
min_held_list_ver
advanced :
min_held_list_ver
.send_if_modified( if last-sent mhlv < known mhlv );
From the PI files, ..., create one output SSTable file.
With
db_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
Insert the output SSTable file into the
output_node
.
/* We're modyfing a node that's already in the LL. This is safe to do b/c the exclusive guard on
db_state
guarantees that no
txn
and no
F+C
is reading the node. */
scnd_idxs
[ sv_spec ].
is_readable
= true ;
Serialize ScndIdxsState to disk.
/* B/c we need to write to disk, we need an exclusive guard.
Hence it's not useful to make is_readable be typed AtomicBool. */
With
lsm_state
.
lock_exclusive
() :
Unhold
pre_output_commit_ver
and
output_commit_ver
.
Detect a new isolated non-held boundary. If detected,
fc_able_commit_vers
.send(...);
Remove intermediary files.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 398px; height: 1px; padding-top: 2928px; margin-left: 5442px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;

div.div:
SICrJob::
create_scnd_idx
( &Arc< SVSpec > )
Steps:
With
si_cr_mutex
.
lock_exclusive
() :
/* This guard is held for the duration of this secondary index creation job instance. */
/* This lock is likely not required, but the implications of removing it hasn't been completely thought out. */
The creation flow.

div.div:
If a thread is to lock both
db_state
and
lsm_state
, it must lock
db_state
first, then
lsm_state
.

switch.text: If a thread is to lock both db_state and...
